18#ifndef _GLOB_H
19#define _GLOB_H 1
20
21#ifdef __cplusplus
22extern "C" {
23#endif
24
25#undef __ptr_t
26#if defined __cplusplus || (defined __STDC__ && __STDC__) || defined WINDOWS32
27# if !defined __GLIBC__
28# undef __P
29# undef __PMT
30# define __P(protos) protos
31# define __PMT(protos) protos
32# if !defined __GNUC__ || __GNUC__ < 2
33# undef __const
34# define __const const
35# endif
36# endif
37# define __ptr_t void *
38#else /* Not C++ or ANSI C. */
39# undef __P
40# undef __PMT
41# define __P(protos) ()
42# define __PMT(protos) ()
43# undef __const
44# define __const
45# define __ptr_t char *
46#endif /* C++ or ANSI C. */
47
48/* We need `size_t' for the following definitions. */
49#ifndef __size_t
50# if defined __FreeBSD__
51# define __size_t size_t
52# else
53# if defined __GNUC__ && __GNUC__ >= 2
54typedef __SIZE_TYPE__ __size_t;
55# else
56/* This is a guess. */
57/*hb
58 * Conflicts with DECCs aready defined type __size_t.
59 * Defining an own type with a name beginning with '__' is no good.
60 * Anyway if DECC is used and __SIZE_T is defined then __size_t is
61 * already defined (and I hope it's exactly the one we need here).
62 */
63# if !(defined __DECC && defined __SIZE_T)
64typedef unsigned long int __size_t;
65# endif
66# endif
67# endif
68#else
69/* The GNU CC stddef.h version defines __size_t as empty. We need a real
70 definition. */
71# undef __size_t
72# define __size_t size_t
73#endif
74
75/* Bits set in the FLAGS argument to `glob'. */
76#define GLOB_ERR (1 << 0)/* Return on read errors. */
77#define GLOB_MARK (1 << 1)/* Append a slash to each name. */
78#define GLOB_NOSORT (1 << 2)/* Don't sort the names. */
79#define GLOB_DOOFFS (1 << 3)/* Insert PGLOB->gl_offs NULLs. */
80#define GLOB_NOCHECK (1 << 4)/* If nothing matches, return the pattern. */
81#define GLOB_APPEND (1 << 5)/* Append to results of a previous call. */
82#define GLOB_NOESCAPE (1 << 6)/* Backslashes don't quote metacharacters. */
83#define GLOB_PERIOD (1 << 7)/* Leading `.' can be matched by metachars. */
84
85#if (!defined _POSIX_C_SOURCE || _POSIX_C_SOURCE < 2 || defined _BSD_SOURCE \
86 || defined _GNU_SOURCE)
87# define GLOB_MAGCHAR (1 << 8)/* Set in gl_flags if any metachars seen. */
88# define GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC (1 << 9)/* Use gl_opendir et al functions. */
89# define GLOB_BRACE (1 << 10)/* Expand "{a,b}" to "a" "b". */
90# define GLOB_NOMAGIC (1 << 11)/* If no magic chars, return the pattern. */
91# define GLOB_TILDE (1 << 12)/* Expand ~user and ~ to home directories. */
92# define GLOB_ONLYDIR (1 << 13)/* Match only directories. */
93# define GLOB_TILDE_CHECK (1 << 14)/* Like GLOB_TILDE but return an error
94 if the user name is not available. */
95# define __GLOB_FLAGS (GLOB_ERR|GLOB_MARK|GLOB_NOSORT|GLOB_DOOFFS| \
96 GLOB_NOESCAPE|GLOB_NOCHECK|GLOB_APPEND| \
97 GLOB_PERIOD|GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC|GLOB_BRACE| \
98 GLOB_NOMAGIC|GLOB_TILDE|GLOB_ONLYDIR|GLOB_TILDE_CHECK)
99#else
100# define __GLOB_FLAGS (GLOB_ERR|GLOB_MARK|GLOB_NOSORT|GLOB_DOOFFS| \
101 GLOB_NOESCAPE|GLOB_NOCHECK|GLOB_APPEND| \
102 GLOB_PERIOD)
103#endif
104
105/* Error returns from `glob'. */
106#define GLOB_NOSPACE 1 /* Ran out of memory. */
107#define GLOB_ABORTED 2 /* Read error. */
108#define GLOB_NOMATCH 3 /* No matches found. */
109#define GLOB_NOSYS 4 /* Not implemented. */
110#ifdef _GNU_SOURCE
111/* Previous versions of this file defined GLOB_ABEND instead of
112 GLOB_ABORTED. Provide a compatibility definition here. */
113# define GLOB_ABEND GLOB_ABORTED
114#endif
115
116/* Structure describing a globbing run. */
117#if !defined _AMIGA && !defined VMS /* Buggy compiler. */
118struct stat;
119#endif
120typedef struct
121 {
122 __size_t gl_pathc; /* Count of paths matched by the pattern. */
123 char **gl_pathv; /* List of matched pathnames. */
124 __size_t gl_offs; /* Slots to reserve in `gl_pathv'. */
125 int gl_flags; /* Set to FLAGS, maybe | GLOB_MAGCHAR. */
126
127 /* If the GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC flag is set, the following functions
128 are used instead of the normal file access functions. */
129 void (*gl_closedir) __PMT ((void *));
130 struct dirent *(*gl_readdir) __PMT ((void *));
131 __ptr_t (*gl_opendir) __PMT ((__const char *));
132 int (*gl_lstat) __PMT ((__const char *, struct stat *));
133#if defined(VMS) && defined(__DECC) && !defined(_POSIX_C_SOURCE)
134 int (*gl_stat) __PMT ((__const char *, struct stat *, ...));
135#else
136 int (*gl_stat) __PMT ((__const char *, struct stat *));
137#endif
138 } glob_t;
139
140#ifdef _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE
141struct stat64;
142typedef struct
143 {
144 __size_t gl_pathc;
145 char **gl_pathv;
146 __size_t gl_offs;
147 int gl_flags;
148
149 /* If the GLOB_ALTDIRFUNC flag is set, the following functions
150 are used instead of the normal file access functions. */
151 void (*gl_closedir) __PMT ((void *));
152 struct dirent64 *(*gl_readdir) __PMT ((void *));
153 __ptr_t (*gl_opendir) __PMT ((__const char *));
154 int (*gl_lstat) __PMT ((__const char *, struct stat64 *));
155 int (*gl_stat) __PMT ((__const char *, struct stat64 *));
156 } glob64_t;
157#endif
158
159#if _FILE_OFFSET_BITS == 64 && __GNUC__ < 2
160# define glob glob64
161# define globfree globfree64
162#else
163# ifdef _LARGEFILE64_SOURCE
164extern int glob64 __P ((__const char *__pattern, int __flags,
165 int (*__errfunc) (__const char *, int),
166 glob64_t *__pglob));
167
168extern void globfree64 __P ((glob64_t *__pglob));
169# endif
170#endif
171
172/* Do glob searching for PATTERN, placing results in PGLOB.
173 The bits defined above may be set in FLAGS.
174 If a directory cannot be opened or read and ERRFUNC is not nil,
175 it is called with the pathname that caused the error, and the
176 `errno' value from the failing call; if it returns non-zero
177 `glob' returns GLOB_ABEND; if it returns zero, the error is ignored.
178 If memory cannot be allocated for PGLOB, GLOB_NOSPACE is returned.
179 Otherwise, `glob' returns zero. */
180#if _FILE_OFFSET_BITS != 64 || __GNUC__ < 2
181extern int glob __P ((__const char *__pattern, int __flags,
182 int (*__errfunc) (__const char *, int),
183 glob_t *__pglob));
184
185/* Free storage allocated in PGLOB by a previous `glob' call. */
186extern void globfree __P ((glob_t *__pglob));
187#else
188extern int glob __P ((__const char *__pattern, int __flags,
189 int (*__errfunc) (__const char *, int),
190 glob_t *__pglob)) __asm__ ("glob64");
191
192extern void globfree __P ((glob_t *__pglob)) __asm__ ("globfree64");
193#endif
194
195
196#ifdef _GNU_SOURCE
197/* Return nonzero if PATTERN contains any metacharacters.
198 Metacharacters can be quoted with backslashes if QUOTE is nonzero.
199
200 This function is not part of the interface specified by POSIX.2
201 but several programs want to use it. */
202extern int glob_pattern_p __P ((__const char *__pattern, int __quote));
203#endif
204
205#ifdef __cplusplus
206}
207#endif
208
209#endif /* glob.h */
210
